Given today's vote 2-3 against my motion with Supervisor @KathrynBarger to keep outdoor dining open with restrictions, we need a new path forward.

I have asked that eligibility for the Business Revitalization Grant be expanded to include restaurants that desperately need it.

I don't support shutting down outdoor dining in LA County right now. 

I don't think we have the data to prove dining is driving the recent surge or to rationalize the number of people who would lose their jobs. I'm also worried it will drive more people to gather indoors.

I have never before experienced the kind of pushback I am hearing on the proposed outdoor dining restriction. 

The fact of the matter is the public doesn't think this recommendation is right and they don't think it is going to work. That's why I'm asking these questions today.

Just asked our @lapublichealth officials about the degree to which outdoor dining is driving the spread of COVID-19 in LA County. 

If we are going to ask people to sacrifice their livelihoods they need to trust that these decisions will actually make a difference.

If we are going to ask people to sacrifice‚Äî not only quality time with their loved ones but also in many cases their paychecks‚Äî they need to trust that these decisions are the right ones and that they will actually make a difference.
